name: Hotel Laimer Hof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Laimer Hof in Munich our last couple of nights in Europe after a 2 week visit. The Hotel Laimer Hof is in a beautiful, peaceful residential neighborhood. We were a little concerned that the Hotel Laimer Hof was away from Alstadt Munich. But the stay could not have been better!
reviews.title: Felt like we were at home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sebastin made us feel so welcomed. He took time to visit with us and orient us to the neighborhood. The stay in the Hotel Laimer Hof was one of the highlights of the trip. We stayed in Room 25 (a turret room on the top floor). The room was comfortable and spotless. The housekeeping staff does an excellent job. I don't believe there is an elevator so if that is an issue make sure you request a ground floor room.
reviews.title: Sebastian is Outstanding - Great Hotel
AWESOME PLACE TO STAY
reviews.text: The hotel is conveniently located a block or two from the Nymphenburg Palace and grounds which we visited. My husband is a runner and enjoyed running the grounds of the palace. We also visited the Hirschgartens and dined there one evening. We would have never found the place without Sebastin's help. We also dined the next night at a local restaurant we never would have found on our own. Both places were excellent.
We were visiting during Euro 2008 and Sebastin held a viewing party for his guests in the comfortable lobby while Germany and Austria played one evening.
reviews.title: Great hotel!
Very Good Customer Service
reviews.text: The Hotel also provides a good breakfast. We would definitely stay at the Hotel Laimer Hof again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back and my wife and I wanted to drop a great review for this great little hotel. Alexandra and the rest of the staff were extremely nice and wonderful to us.
reviews.title: Great Place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is not a high end hotel with every amenity known to man, rather, it is exactly what it should be, a clean, very pretty, comfortable, and cozy place to stay. The room was small, but very nice. Ok, the shower was a bit weird (the controls were outside of the shower) but this seemed to add to the quaintness of the place.
reviews.title: Delightful stay in Munich

reviews.text: The bed was extremely comfortable, and the breakfast that was included in our rate was the best of our trip. The best part of this hotel is the location. It's not downtown, which after staying downtown we can say that is a good thing. The neighborhood around the hotel is wonderful, walkable, and quiet. There are a a large beer garden and several very excellent restaurants within 3 blocks, not to mention several historical landmarks as well.
reviews.title: Absolutely LOVED the Laimer Hof

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alexandra made excellent recommendations for dining, and the other staff was always willing to answer any questions.
reviews.title: Don't be put off by its location away from downtown!
Loved the Hotel Laimer Hof
reviews.text: We can't say more about this place and will come back for sure!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the location of the hotel. It was very quiet. The room was a nice size and very clean. The staff in the hotel were all excellent. Had a very nice chat with one of the young ladies when we came back from the Hirshgarten (sp). We visited the Nymphberg palace which is within easy walking distance of the hotel. The tram is only about a pleasant 10 minute walk from the hotel and you can buy tickets from the front desk for 9 euros which is good for 5 people ( I beleive 2 adults and 3 children). The rooms come with fans which are sufficient if it is warm outside. It also has an English movie channel (free) which is rare for smaller hotels in Europe. You can get a bit tired of watching CNN and BBC every night. I would definitley stay at the Laimer Hof without hesitation. There are also four free parking spots at the hotel or you can find parking for free on the street. The breakfast buffet was also nice. There is also a free computer to use in the lobby.
reviews.title: Loved the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has taken a while to write this review, simply because my wife and I have finally taken the pictures from our trip to Munich and hung them up and it brought me back to this wonderful trip...and most importantly to the reader, our stay at Hotel Laimer.
reviews.title: Will Be Back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon landing in Munich, it was a quick 30 minute train ride to Laimer trainstation. From there, it was a brisk and direct 10 minute walk to the hotel from the trainstation. I highly recommend you check Hotel Laimer's website, for the do an excellent job highlighting the several options available to getting to the hotel. For my wife and I, being able to rely solely on public transportation and good ol' fashion walking was one of primary reasons for picking this hotel. On that point, even though it is located in the suburbs of Munich (about a 10-15 minute train ride to the city center), the tram, buses, and of course, train system are within 2 and 10 mins. walk respectively. For my wife and I, we just loved being able to get up at 6am, finish breakfast by 7am, catch the train by 7:10, be at Marienplatz (city center) by 7:25, and shop for mid-morning snacks at the outdoor Viktualienmarkt by 7:30.
reviews.title: Excelent Place to Stay in Munich

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beyond location, the staff at Hotel Laimer were extremely helpful. The owners and staff are proficient in English, and know exactly the types of questions that need answers before the tourist even knows to ask them. They also had helpful recommendations for eating out, sightseeing, and participating in the local culture. The manager was even kind enough to leave us with a souvenior before our departure (tea mugs with Hotel logo) to bring us back to our trip, every time we drink tea.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved the comfort and the family atmosphere

reviews.text: Every morning, breakfast is served as it would be on a local family's breakfast table, and it was a joy to be able to live like a German for the week in this capacity. Cold cuts, fresh fruit and juice, musli and ceraels, and baked delights (I was particularly fond of the Nutella spread on whole grain rolls). Being vegetarians, there was plenty to be satisfied with, if that is a concern of yours.
reviews.title: What I had hoped...and more

likes.liked: — Interaction with Staff, when it comes to special accomodations and suggestions

reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay at Laimer Hof. The hosts were gracious. We arrived at 8:30am. Our room was not ready (didn't expect it to be at that hour), but it was no problem to have our luggage held. We were then offered breakfast. When we declined, we were offered coffee, tea, chocolate. We settled for directions to downtown and recommendations for things to see.
reviews.title: Charming small hotel

reviews.text: Our room was on the ground floor. It was small for American standards (similar to a nice cruise ship cabin), but cozy. All of the rooms on that floor appeared to be the same size except for the one at the end. The bathroom was spacious. Everything was exceptionally clean. Breakfast was very good and had a nice selection of baked goods, deli meats, cheeses, yogurt, fruit, etc.
reviews.title: Lived Up to the Reviews

reviews.text: As for location, it suited us well. But if you want to stay in the city center, it's probably not for you. The tram ride to the city center is 7-10min and I would rather stay by Nymphenburg than the main train station.
reviews.title: Wnderful hospitality

reviews.text: Loved our stay at his hotel.
reviews.title: normal 3 stars hotel or pension

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would agree that it is not the place for you if you are looking to stay in the heart of downtown Munich.
reviews.title: Extremely friendly host

description: The location of the hotel is one of the finest in Munich, very close to Nymphenburg Palace with many museums, and simply unique. Europe's largest beer garden, the Königlicher Hirschgarten (the Royal Stag Garden), is only a few minutes away on foot. Direct public transport connections to all the sights and attractions of Munich by bus, tram and rapid-transit railway can be reached from the hotel in only a few minutes.The hotel provides its guests with everything required by modern business people or visitors to Munich who are in love with Nymphenburg Palace.But what is most important: your hosts Sebastian and Alexandra are passionate hoteliers. The chance to offer hospitality, friendliness and the best possible service is the focal point of their life.
